ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
A day when you see the earth shaken with its shaking, and the earth brings forth its burdens, then the people will issue forth in groups to see their deeds. A day when the earth and the mountains are carried and crushed with a single crushing, then the Event (Al-Waqi'ah) has occurred and the sky is split, so it is on that day weak, and the angels are on its edges, and the Throne (Arsh) of your Lord is carried above them on that day by eight. On that day you will be presented, nothing hidden from you will be concealed. A day when the mountains will move and you see the earth bare. A day when the earth will be shaken with its shaking and the mountains will be scattered with scattering, so they become scattered dust. A day when the people will be like scattered moths (Al-Farash Al-Mabthuth) and the mountains will be like carded wool. A day when every nursing mother will be distracted from what she nursed, and every pregnant one will deliver her pregnancy, and you see the people intoxicated, yet they are not intoxicated, but the punishment of Allah is severe. A day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth and the heavens, and they will appear before Allah, the One, the Subduer (Al-Qahhar). A day when the mountains will be blown away with blowing, leaving a level plain where you see no crookedness nor unevenness. A day when you see the mountains, you think them fixed, yet they pass like the passing of clouds. A day when the sky is split, so it becomes like red leather. Then on that day, no human or jinn will be asked about his sin. A day when the disobedient will be prevented from speech, and no one will be asked about crimes, but they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet. A day when every soul (Nafs) will find what it did of good present, and what it did of evil, it wishes there were a great distance between it and that. A day when every soul (Nafs) will know what it has brought and will testify to what it sent ahead and left behind. A day when the tongues will be silenced and the limbs will speak. A day whose mention turned gray the Master of the Messengers (Sayyid Al-Mursalin) when the Truthful One (Al-Siddiq), may Allah be pleased with him, said to him: 'I see you have turned gray, O Messenger of Allah.' He said: 'Surah Hud and its sisters have turned me gray [155]'â€”and they are Al-Waqi'ah, Al-Mursalat, 'Amma Yatasa'alun, and 'Idha Al-Shamsu Kuwwirat.

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Remembrance of Death and the Afterlife
Indeed, you have known the terror [houl] of the Scales [al-mizan] and its peril, and that eyes will be staring fixedly at the tongue of the Scales. **"Then as for he whose scales are heavy, he will be in a pleasant life. But as for he whose scales are light, his refuge will be an abyss. And what can make you know what that is? It is a Fire, intensely hot."** And know that none is saved from the peril of the Scales except he who, in this world [al-dunya], holds his soul to account [hasaba] and weighs therein, with the scale [mizan] of the Sacred Law, his deeds, his words, his passing thoughts, and his glances, just as 'Umar, may God be pleased with him, said: "Hold yourselves to account before you are held to account, and weigh yourselves before you are weighed." And his holding his soul to account is that he repents from every sin before death with a sincere repentance [tawba], and makes up for what he has neglected of his shortcomings in the obligations [fara'id] of God, the Exalted, and he restores wrongfully taken rights, grain by grain, and seeks to be absolved by everyone he has confronted with his tongue, his hand, and the evil of his assumption [su' al-zann] with his heart, by purifying their hearts, until he dies and no wrongful claim or obligatory duty remains upon him. This one enters Paradise without reckoning. But if he dies before restoring the wrongfully taken rights, his adversaries will surround him. This one will seize his hand, and this one will grip his forelock, and this one will cling to his collar. This one says, "You wronged me [zalamtani]!" And this one says, "You insulted me!" And this one says, "You mocked me!" And this one says, "You mentioned me in backbiting [al-ghiba] with what displeased me!" And this one says, "You were my neighbor and you were a bad neighbor to me!" And this one says, "You dealt with me and you cheated me!" And this one says, "You sold to me and you defrauded me and concealed from me the defect in your merchandise!" And this one says, "You lied about the price of your goods!" And this one says, "You saw me in need while you were wealthy, yet you did not feed me!" And this one says, "You found me wronged while you were capable of repelling the wrong from me, yet you appeased the wrongdoer and did not regard me!" And while you are in that state, with the adversaries having sunk their claws into you and firmly fixed their hands upon your collar, and you are bewildered, perplexed by their multitudeâ€”until there remains no one in your lifetime whom you dealt with for a single dirham or sat with in a gathering except that he has a rightful claim against you for a wrong [muzlima] through backbiting, betrayal, or a look with an eye of contemptâ€”and you have become too weak to resist them, and you stretch forth the neck of hope to your Master and Protector, that perhaps He may deliver you from their hands, then the call of the Compeller, majestic is His glory, strikes your hearing: **"Today, every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today!"** At that, your heart [qalb] is torn out from awe [al-hayba], and your soul [nafs] becomes certain of ruin [al-bawar], and you remember what God, the Exalted, warned you through the tongue of His Messenger, where He said: **"And never think that God is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror], racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance not returning to them, and their hearts [af'ida] void.
